arguments.info: The canned ACL to apply. Available values include private, public-read, and public-read-write. Defaults to private.
The name of a bucket to be created.
A rule of Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (documented below).

subblock.info: Specifies which headers are allowed.
Specifies which methods are allowed. Can be GET, PUT, POST, DELETE or HEAD.
Specifies which origins are allowed.
Specifies expose header in the response.
Specifies time in seconds that browser can cache the response for a preflight request.

arguments.info: A configuration of object lifecycle management (documented below).

subblock.info: Specifies a period in the object's expire (documented below).
Specifies the date after which you want the corresponding action to take effect.
Specifies the number of days after object creation when the specific rule action takes effect.
Object key prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.
Specifies a period in the object's transitions (documented below).
Specifies the date after which you want the corresponding action to take effect.
Specifies the number of days after object creation when the specific rule action takes effect.
Specifies the storage class to which you want the object to transition. Available values include STANDARD, STANDARD_IA and ARCHIVE.

arguments.info: A website object(documented below).

subblock.info: An absolute path to the document to return in case of a 4XX error.
COS returns this index document when requests are made to the root domain or any of the subfolders.

arguments.info: The canned ACL to apply. Available values include private, public-read, and public-read-write. Defaults to private.
The name of a bucket to use.
Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.For further details，RFC2616 can be referred.
Literal string value to use as the object content, which will be uploaded as UTF-8-encoded text.
Specifies presentational information for the object.
Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.
A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
The ETag generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content).
The name of the object once it is in the bucket.
The path to the source file being uploaded to the bucket.
Object storage type, Available values include STANDARD, STANDARD_IA and ARCHIVE.

attributes.info: The canned ACL to apply. Available values include private, public-read, and public-read-write. Defaults to private.
The name of a bucket to use.

Literal string value to use as the object content, which will be uploaded as UTF-8-encoded text.
Specifies presentational information for the object.
Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.
A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
The ETag generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content).
The name of the object once it is in the bucket.
The path to the source file being uploaded to the bucket.
Object storage type, Available values include STANDARD, STANDARD_IA and ARCHIVE.

arguments.info: Account name.
List of specified database name.
Instance ID.

Database permissions. Available values for Privileges: "SELECT", "INSERT", "UPDATE", "DELETE", "CREATE", "DROP", "REFERENCES", "INDEX", "ALTER", "CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES", "LOCK TABLES","EXECUTE", "CREATE VIEW", "SHOW VIEW", "CREATE ROUTINE", "ALTER ROUTINE", "EVENT", and "TRIGGER".

attributes.info: Account name.
List of specified database name.
Instance ID.

Database permissions. Available values for Privileges: "SELECT", "INSERT", "UPDATE", "DELETE", "CREATE", "DROP", "REFERENCES", "INDEX", "ALTER", "CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES", "LOCK TABLES","EXECUTE", "CREATE VIEW", "SHOW VIEW", "CREATE ROUTINE", "ALTER ROUTINE", "EVENT", and "TRIGGER".

arguments.info: Backup method. Supported values include: physical - physical backup, and logical - logical backup.

Instance backup time, in the format of "HH:mm-HH:mm". Time setting interval is four hours. Default to "02:00-06:00". The following value can be supported: 02:00\-06:00, 06:00\-10:00, 10:00\-14:00, 14:00\-18:00, 18:00\-22:00, and 22:00\-02:00.
Instance ID to which policies will be applied.
Instance backup retention days. Valid values: [7-730]. And default value is 7.

attributes.info: Backup method. Supported values include: physical - physical backup, and logical - logical backup.

Instance backup time, in the format of "HH:mm-HH:mm". Time setting interval is four hours. Default to "02:00-06:00". The following value can be supported: 02:00\-06:00, 06:00\-10:00, 10:00\-14:00, 14:00\-18:00, 18:00\-22:00, and 22:00\-02:00.
Retention period for binlog in days.
Instance ID to which policies will be applied.
Instance backup retention days. Valid values: [7-730]. And default value is 7.

arguments.info: Indicates which availability zone will be used.
The version number of the database engine to use. Supported versions include 5.5/5.6/5.7, and default is 5.7.
Zone information about first slave instance.
The name of a mysql instance.
Indicates whether to enable the access to an instance from public network: 0 - No, 1 - Yes.
Public access port, rang form 1024 to 65535 and default value is 3306.
Memory size (in MB).
List of parameters to use.
Project ID, default value is 0.
Password of root account. This parameter can be specified when you purchase master instances, but it should be ignored when you purchase read-only instances or disaster recovery instances.
Zone information about second slave instance.
Security groups to use.
Availability zone deployment method. Available values: 0 - Single availability zone; 1 - Multiple availability zones.
Data replication mode. 0 - Async replication; 1 - Semisync replication; 2 - Strongsync replication.
Private network ID. If vpc_id is set, this value is required.
Instance tags.
Disk size (in GB).
ID of VPC, which can be modified once every 24 hours and can’t be removed.

arguments.info: Specifys which day the backup action should take place. Supported values include: Monday，Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday.
Specifys what time the backup action should take place.

arguments.info: The available zone ID of an instance to be created., refer to tencentcloud_redis_zone_config.list
The memory volume of an available instance(in MB), refer to tencentcloud_redis_zone_config.list[zone].mem_sizes
Instance name.
Password for a Redis user，which should be 8 to 16 characters.
The port used to access a redis instance. The default value is 6379. And this value can't be changed after creation, or the Redis instance will be recreated.
Specifies which project the instance should belong to.
ID of security group. If both vpc_id and subnet_id are not set, this argument should not be set either.
Specifies which subnet the instance should belong to.
Instance type. Available values: master_slave_redis.
ID of the vpc with which the instance is to be associated.

attributes.info: The available zone ID of an instance to be created., refer to tencentcloud_redis_zone_config.list
The time when the instance was created.
IP address of an instance.
The memory volume of an available instance(in MB), refer to tencentcloud_redis_zone_config.list[zone].mem_sizes
Instance name.
Password for a Redis user，which should be 8 to 16 characters.
The port used to access a redis instance. The default value is 6379. And this value can't be changed after creation, or the Redis instance will be recreated.
Specifies which project the instance should belong to.
ID of security group. If both vpc_id and subnet_id are not set, this argument should not be set either.
Current status of an instance，maybe: init, processing, online, isolate and todelete.
Specifies which subnet the instance should belong to.
Instance type. Available values: master_slave_redis.
ID of the vpc with which the instance is to be associated.
